forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain and a slight chance of thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. East southeast wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 1pm, then rain and a slight chance of thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southeast wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the early hours bring a symphony of rain, accompanied by a whisper of thunder, casting a curtain of clouds over the city. The damp chill stirs memories of cozy nooks, beckoning you to seek solace indoors while the streets glisten with the promise of moisture. At around 52 degrees, the air tingles against your skin, gradually rising until dawn breaks around 54. The east-southeast winds, though gentle, dance with playful gusts, hinting at a bustling day ahead. 

By Wednesday afternoon, expect the rain to persist, ensuring the clouds remain heavy with moisture. The day will feel cool, as temperatures flirt with a high of 58 before retreating to 56. With a 90% chance of precipitation, today's charm lies in listening to the raindrops tapping against windowpanes, perfect for settling down with a good book, or perhaps indulging in steaming cups of artisan coffee at your favorite café. Dress with layers—consider a waterproof jacket and sturdy shoes—to keep comfortable as you navigate the slick pavement. Today is ideal for savoring the quietude that a rainy day brings, inviting moments of reflection or connection over warm conversations.
